item.description:
The Carter Moriah Range consists of 10 miles of mountains just east of the Presidential Range. Eight of its peaks are above 4,000 feet. We'll attempt Mt. Hight. To the east of the range lies the forested valley of the Wild River and the rocky peaks of the Baldface Group. On a clear day the Atlantic can be seen glistening beyond Sebago Lake to the southeast. 

AT 4,675 feet above sea level Mt. Hight will be our most ambitious summit of the winter hiking season. With about 3,200 feet of vertcal climbing this playground east of the Presidentials is in the shadow of Carter Dome and my heart. Our efforts will be well rewarded with the 360 degree views that Ole Man Winter enjoys.

The first leg of this adventure will begin on the 19 mile Brook Trail. The parking lot (e-1,487')for this jaunt is on the right hand side of route 16 and one mile north of the Mt. Washington Auto Road. We'll follow this frequently hiked trail (used by hikers going to the Carter Notch Hut) for 1.9 miles. The real fun begins as we turn west/left onto the Carter Dome Trail. Over this flexuous pathwe'll gain about 1,600 vertical feet over 1.9 miles. The grade is moderate but relentless. As trail steepens a series of switchbacks will deliver us softly to the Zeta Pass. Upon reaching the Zeta Pass the Carter Dome Trail and the Carter Mariah Trail are the same trail heading south (also it's the AT), we'll take this right hand/south turn. After 0.2 of a mile we'll bear slight left toward the Summit of Mt. Hight on the Carter Mariah Trail. From this junction we'll cover the last 0.6 of a mile over steep terrain exposed to weather. (Continuing on to the Carter Dome, 4,832', is 0.4 of a mile for peak baggers. It's unlikely we'll have time for that summit.) We'll return to the parking lot via the same path. Total mileage about 8.4 miles, hiking time estimate 7 hours.

Weather and Trailing conditions: Too early to tell. Check back. Although the AMC Visitor's Center got 12 inches of new show this past weekend. Tip: Dressing comfortably at the summit would enable you to enjoy the breezy but wonderous view.

To participate you should: •Be comfortable hiking UPHILL at about 1.5 miles per hour (moderate pace) at a 15% incline for about 4 miles. •Be comfortable walking at least 8 miles on uneven terrain including ice. •Be able to carry pack weight for all the required gear. (1 liter of water alone weighs 2 pounds!) •Be in good physical condition.

Mandatory Equipment List: •Katoola Microspikes or Hillsound Trail Crampons •Snowshoes •Synthetic shirt and waterproof pants. No cotton! No jeans! •Rain/Wind Jacket with hood. No Ponchos! •Warm fleece layers. •Warm gloves or preferably mittens. (2 pair is strongly recommended.) •Warm fleece or wool hat. •Balaclava •Goggles(preferred) and/or Sunglasses •at leaset 3 liters Water in wide-mouth bottles. No hydration systems! •Headlamp •Spare batteries for Headlamp (Bring Lithium, not Alkaline batteries) •Trail Snacks suitable for freezing weather. (You don't want something that turns into a rock when frozen.) •Lunch •Boots - A pair of winter hiking boots is mandatory.

Tip: Ensure that your water is accessible while hiking. Frequent sips will ensure proper hydration. Optional Gear: •Hiking Poles - strongly recommended •Gaiters •Camera / Binoculars •Toe warmers and hand warmers •Ibuprofen •Insulated Thermos (hot tea etc)

Liability Waiver: As a condition of your voluntary participation in this activity you acknowledge and agree to the following: this activity involves inherent risks that can cause property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death to participants and/or others; you assume all risk associated with this activity; you are responsible for having the necessary knowledge, skills, abilities, clothing, and equipment to safely participate in this activity; you know and will follow the Hiker Responsibility Code described at www.hikesafe.com; the leader(s) of this activity are volunteers; and you for yourself, your heirs, executors, and administrators release, hold harmless, and indemnify the leader(s) and all members of this group from any and all claims for property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death - including those caused by negligence and/or other reasons.

Car Pool - it saves the trees! Lastly, possible stop for dinner and cold beer or hot chocolate after.
item.name: Mt. Hight on High Hike
